title: Where there’s muck, there’s brass: The booming business of recycling
text:
At Green Recycling in Essex, Max is hard at work as a river of rubbish passes along the conveyor belt below.

As the waste arrives–- used cardboard, plastic bottles and food cartons – Max’s arm is a blur. Whipping out to grab each piece before zipping out to the side of the conveyor belt, dropping it into the correct bin before repeating the process at an inhuman speed.

Which makes sense, because Max is a robot. “We first spotted Max at a waste show in the UK in November 2017,” says Green Recycling’s general manager Jamie Smith. “We have always wanted to move into robotics and are keen to push new technology. Max has been very successful.”
